question_details.query: What is the most cost-effective way to provide dietary enrichment for captive primates?

summary_details.relevant_summary: One replicated, controlled study in the USA reported that an enrichment task took less time to complete when monkeys were in social groups than when feeding alone [1343]. One before-and-after study in Italy found that in the presence of their groupmates monkeys ate more unfamiliar foods during the first encounter [1343]. One replicated, before-and-after study in the Netherlands and Germany found that when presented with stinging nettles captive gorillas used the same processing skills as wild gorillas to forage [1332]. No evidence was captured for the effects of providing nectar (including artificial nectar) to primates [1331].

question_details.query: Which is a more effective breeding stimulus for amphibians: simulating rainfall with sound recordings or allowing them to hibernate?

summary_details.relevant_summary: There is no evidence to support the effectiveness of simulating rainfall with sound recordings or allowing temperate amphibians to hibernate as a breeding stimulus (1867, 1868).

question_details.query: What is the recommended protocol for managing the dental health of captive carnivores?

summary_details.relevant_summary: No actions were found that directly address a recommended protocol for managing the dental health of captive carnivores.
